Keywords: Armor , Excalibur , Utopia , X-Force , X-Men
Real Name: Piotr Rasputin
Special Powers
MOVEMENT: Destroy Blocking
RALLY (5): Opposing Attack Rolls. When Colossus uses Impervious, before rolling the d6 you may instead remove his RALLY die to use it as the result. (RALLY: Once per roll for each die in a finalized attack roll and for all characters with a matching RALLY die and trait color printed under their trait star, after resolutions you may choose a friendly character to gain a matching RALLY die. RALLY trait colors specify which attack type they can gain RALLY dies from. BLUE = Friendly Attack Rolls. RED = Opposing Attack Rolls. GREEN = All Attack Rolls. When a character gains a RALLY die, place a die with the matching result on their card.)
HUH, YOUR BEST WAS NOT ENOUGH: Impervious. Protected: Outwit.

September 24, 2021
SpyderNick88
I feel like bcf was a clever way to replace super strength. I look at it like he's smashing someone with a large, destructive object.
August 16, 2021
tidge
Except for very specific circumstances, this will be my go-to Colossus. The lack of Super Strength makes me sad and B/C/F makes me cross-eyed, but Impervious that cannot be outwitted, plus the attack/damage values, plus Empower (with solid move values... through solid terrain), plus his particular RALLY... what is there not to love?
August 16, 2021
pokolo
BCF feels out of place on this guy... i get super strength is benched and basically nerfed but i think full dial quake would have been fine, or some sort of special or nothing at all instead in those slots... other than that though, this is a solid dial.
August 11, 2021
Goop
A guaranteed impervious roll from the rally die is really nice. Its also just a visual deterrent to even attack him if you dont have anything penetrating. Good values and powers, strong figure. Little odd he has blades with cce at end.
July 16, 2021
SpaceTitanium
This guy may legitimately be my top want from the set. Not having Super Strength is a shame, but i never really consider pete a "hit people with things" guy so quake does fine. But that defence power is the star of the show. So much potential to just stick around against grunts and he even has a bit of colossonaut in there with his IM. When the world gets back on track enough to actually play, this guy and HoX wolverine are the first things hitting that table.

Organous
I know from the Legendary Deck Building Game that he gets a "Soulsword" at some point as he starts cutting his way through demons to get Magik out of Hell, so yeah there's precedent to that. Whether this is the Soulsword, I got no idea.
May 30, 2021
DarkTortoise23
Honestly I'm in love with it. Impervious down the dial that you *have* to deal with unless you deal penetrating? And he can guarantee a success on it if theres a 5 in an enemy attack roll? Sold, ez. Sure penetrators are a dime a dozen lately but played right this could easily be one of the best(and toughest)versions of Piotr in a while. Only thing that confuses me is the Blades/claws/fangs...did he get a sword at some point in a recent book?
May 29, 2021
Organous
Correct, since BCF replaces the normal damage. Still, if you lose CCE (or if you're on click 3), it makes for some potential of extra damage. My take: [b]Finally![/b] A Colossus with not-10 attack value! This guy could actually hit something! In fact, with CCE, he has 11 consistently through the dial. Considering he's just bulk without much for maneuverability or utility, I'd say this is a reasonable use of points, and common at that.
